job_tasks.phrase: As a Software Engineer in ISE specializing in AI Platform, you willteam upwithotherISEengineerson customer engagements involving Microsofts AI offerings such as Azure ML, Azure Cognitive Services, Azure OpenAI, other related MS technologies such as Azure Cognitive Search or open source AI tooling.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes working as a software engineer on customer engagements, integrating Microsoft's AI offerings, which falls under traditional software development and integration of AI solutions.

job_tasks.phrase: By interacting with our customers engineering teams and Microsofts product engineering teams, you will develop real-world technical experience that helps customers grow their business and Microsoft to improve our products and services.
job_tasks.justification: This highlights collaboration with engineering teams and developing technical experience to improve products and services, which is a core software engineering activity.

job_tasks.phrase: We develop solutions side-by-side with our customers through collaborative innovation to solve their challenges.
job_tasks.justification: This describes the process of developing solutions collaboratively with customers, a key aspect of software engineering and integration.

job_tasks.phrase: This work involves the development of broadly applicable, high-impact solution patterns and open-source software assets that contribute to the Microsoft platform.
job_tasks.justification: Focuses on developing software assets and solution patterns, which are core software engineering deliverables.

job_tasks.phrase: In this role, you will be working with engineers from your team and our customers teams to apply your skills, perspectives, and creativity to grow as engineers and help solve our customer challenges.
job_tasks.justification: Emphasizes working with engineering teams to solve customer challenges, reinforcing the software engineering nature of the role.

job_tasks.phrase: Participate in architecture design sessions and coding sprints working alongside ISE engineers and customer engineers to help them make good design decisions specifically around building good AI solutions, for example ML Ops.
job_tasks.justification: Directly mentions participating in architecture design sessions and coding sprints for building AI solutions, including MLOps, which are software engineering tasks.

job_tasks.phrase: This is not a data scientist role - there is a data science team that will partner with you as the engineer on these engagements.
job_tasks.justification: Explicitly states it's not a data scientist role, reinforcing that the focus is on engineering rather than core model development or analysis.

job_tasks.phrase: Be a hands-on software engineer where needed, so youll need to be able to write quality code.
job_tasks.justification: Directly states the need to be a hands-on software engineer and write quality code.

job_tasks.phrase: We often bring Data & AI depth expertise to the existing ISE industry engineering crew that has end-to-end ownership of the customer engagement.
job_tasks.justification: Positions the role as bringing AI expertise to an engineering crew with end-to-end ownership, indicating an integration and support role within a broader engineering context.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with other members of the team and the broader organization to strategically invest in building reusable assets and playbooks built from our customer experiences.
job_tasks.justification: Focuses on building reusable assets and playbooks, which are software engineering outputs.

job_tasks.phrase: specifically around building good AI solutions, for example ML Ops.
job_tasks.justification: Mentions 'ML Ops' as an example of building AI solutions, which falls under the operations and MLOps category.

soft_skills.justification: Indicates teamwork and collaboration with other engineers.

soft_skills.phrase: By interacting with our customers engineering teams and Microsofts product engineering teams
soft_skills.justification: Highlights interaction and collaboration with customer and product engineering teams.

soft_skills.phrase: work alongside ISE engineers and customer engineers
soft_skills.justification: Explicitly mentions working alongside other engineers.

soft_skills.phrase: Collaborate with other members of the team and the broader organization
soft_skills.justification: Directly states collaboration with team members and the organization.

soft_skills.phrase: the ability to quickly upskill and unblock others is the key to success.
soft_skills.justification: Emphasizes the need for quick learning (upskilling) and helping others, which relates to adaptability and knowledge sharing.

soft_skills.phrase: apply your skills, perspectives, and creativity to grow as engineers
soft_skills.justification: Encourages applying creativity and growing as engineers, suggesting a proactive and ownership-oriented approach.

soft_skills.phrase: Our team prides itself on embracing a growth mindset, inspiring excellence, and encouraging everyone to share their unique viewpoints and be their authentic selves.
soft_skills.justification: Promotes sharing viewpoints and being authentic, which are aspects of collaboration and team dynamics.

profile.rationale: The job ad explicitly states 'This is not a data scientist role' and emphasizes being a 'hands-on software engineer' who writes quality code. The responsibilities focus on participating in architecture design, coding sprints, building AI solutions (like ML Ops), and developing reusable software assets. While it involves Microsoft's AI offerings (Azure ML, Azure OpenAI, etc.), the core tasks are software development and integration, with a data science team partnering for the modeling aspects. This aligns with the 'AI-Adjacent Software Engineer' profile, where the role builds or maintains software that uses AI/ML features as a core part of its functionality, rather than focusing on the AI model development itself.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear about the nature of the role, explicitly differentiating it from a data scientist position and highlighting software engineering responsibilities. The technologies mentioned are also specific to the AI platform integration rather than core model development. This clarity leads to high confidence in the analysis.
